title: SCP-7887
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:foxtrot]]

[[include component:image-block
    name=https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/scp-7887/ambulocetus.png|
    caption=//Ambulocetus// remains. |
    align=center |
    width=100%
]]

**Special Containment Procedures:** Each SCP-7887 item is stored within a Standard Object Containment Cube at Site-409. Research regarding the origins and utilizations of the objects is ongoing.

------

**Description:** SCP-7887 is a collection of ancient objects, relics, and miscellaneous effects recovered from a shallow cave near Sargodha, Pakistan. The interior of the cave, coated in a thick layer of wax and animal fats, contains several clay bricks of unknown origin -- as well as partially intact //Ambulocetus//[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]An extinct genus of amphibious cetacean that lived during the Eocene.[[/span]] skeletal remains.

SCP-7887 objects (designated SCP-7887-1 through SCP-7887-43) are composed of common materials, and appear only several thousand years old, despite radiocarbon dating methods having confirmed that each instance exceeds thirty-five million years of age. It is unclear how the items remained intact for this amount of time, or how they were created.

= @@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-4
**Date of Recovery:** 02/06/2005
**Description:** A small pot made of red clay, decorated with several simple carvings. Spiral pattern is painted onto object with an unidentified blueish substance.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-7
**Date of Recovery:** 02/06/2005
**Description:** A ceramic sphere. Object produces a prominent clicking sound when shaken.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-11
**Date of Recovery:** 02/06/2005
**Description:** Several //Hypericum antiquum//[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]An extinct species of flowering plant present during the Eocene.[[/span]] wrapped into a bundle with copper wire.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-15
**Date of Recovery:** 02/07/2005
**Description:** A large stone tablet. Object features an array of etched symbols at its base, depicting isolated objects, animals, and scenes.

**Update:** It has been confirmed that these symbols represent a primitive glyph-based language. Rough translation of this text is as follows:

[[=]]
> ##darkgrey|**(BUILD/ESTABLISH)**## ##slategrey|**FOR**##
> ##grey|**[Unknown symbol -- possibly**## ##darkgrey|**LIGHTNING**####grey|**?]**##
[[/=]]

[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-19
**Date of Recovery:** 02/09/2005
**Description:** A sharp copper weapon resembling a scimitar; significantly larger than a regular scimitar.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-20
**Date of Recovery:** 02/09/2005
**Description:** A 10 ft tall, narrow, copper instrument. Believed to be a primitive lightning conductor.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-27
**Date of Recovery:** 02/16/2005
**Description:** A fragment of stonework, broken off from a larger structure. Engravings in the stone display symbols of tall, monolithic objects, as well as a lightning bolt striking a towering plinth.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-31
**Date of Recovery:** 02/17/2005
**Description:** A collection of twenty small gears, bolts, and wheels. Detailing on objects reveals they were once attached to a greater mechanism.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-33
**Date of Recovery:**  02/17/2005
**Description:** A thick sheet of copper, curved into an arch. Object is fitted with several unknown instruments on its underside, including what appears to be a rudimentary steering device.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-37
**Date of Recovery:** 02/18/2005
**Description:** Another stone tablet. Text translates into the following:

[[=]]
> ##slategrey|**DANGER**##
> ##darkgrey|**(CONTORTION/CHANGE)**##
> ##grey|**[Unknown symbol]**##
> ##slategrey|**LAST OPPORTUNITY**##
[[/=]]

[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-39
**Date of Recovery:** 02/18/2005
**Description:** A near-perfectly preserved //Aegyptopithecus zeuxis//[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]An extinct old-world primate which lived during the early Oliogecene.[[/span]] carcass. Carcass was found inside a partially-eroded complex copper device, embedded with numerous rare gemstones. Of note, each gemstone recovered from the device bears large thaumaturgical significance.

**Update:** SCP-7887-42 was later found in a hidden compartment inside the device.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-42
**Date of Recovery:** 02/20/2005
**Description:** A hollow dodecahedroid object made from black onyx, with several unconnected pipes attached to its sides. An as-of-yet unidentified gemstone is fixed to the center of the object, encased in a series of small copper bands. Object emits low levels of thaumaturgic radiation (â‰ˆ3 Caspers/second).
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Item #:** SCP-7887-43
**Date of Recovery:** 03/01/2005
**Description:** A third stone tablet. Text features multiple previously unseen symbols.

[[=]]
> ##darkgrey|**(CONTORTION/CHANGE)**## ##slategrey|**UNSTOPPABLE**##
> ##slategrey|**THE**## ##grey|**[Unknown symbol] [Unknown symbol]**##
>
> ##slategrey|**WHALE ASCEND**##
[[/=]]

[[/div]]

= Following the discovery of SCP-7887-43, no further objects have been found.

= @@ @@

= @@ @@

**Addendum 7887-1, Memorandum (03/28/2021):** Recent studies concerning thaumaturgical activity amidst SCP-7887 objects revealed processes of soul-transference, necromancy, and astral projection. Further investigation uncovered traces of cetacean cognition within the Noosphere. [[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Sphere of all human thought.[[/span]]

The significance of this is unclear.

= @@ @@
